creator.name: Opzichters van de Gemene Weide
creator.his_func: In 1773 the Council of Policy founded a separate committee for the control of the common meadow in Paramaribo, a task that was previously assigned to the Board of Commissioners for Minor Cases in Suriname. Two foresters and four commissioners were appointed. Among their duties: monitoring of streets, grubbing of houses and revetting waterfront. The committee was abolished in 1816; the Council of Policy took over the control task.
creator.Aantekeningen:
Zelf

Roessingh, Guide, p. 67.

Toegang 1.05.10.06, inleiding

Relatie met Board of Commissioners for Small Cases in Suriname.
